intro: Tetracera oblongata var. acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved tetracera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its elongated, acuminate leaves. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with yellowish-green flowers clustered in cyathia. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
